extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups plus 4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: oyster mushrooms
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound oyster mushrooms, sliced into 1/4-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: parsley
extendedIngredients.original: 1 bunch Italian parsley, chopped to yield 1/4 cup
extendedIngredients.originalName: Italian parsley, chopped to yield 1/4 cup

extendedIngredients.name: sage leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 4 large sage leaves, plus 20 smaller leaves

information.title: Chicken
information.summary: The recipe Chicken can be made in approximately 30 minutes. For $6.25 per serving, this recipe covers 39% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains around 56g of protein, 37g of fat, and a total of 795 calories. This recipe serves 4. This recipe from Foodnetwork requires sage leaves, marsala wine, chicken breasts, and salt and pepper. Only a few people really liked this main course. 2 people found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. Overall, this recipe earns a solid spoonacular score of 79%. Try I Ain't Chicken Chicken: Crispy Roasted Chicken Breasts with Orange and Cardamom, I Ain't Chicken Chicken: Crispy Roasted Chicken Breasts with Orange and Cardamom, and I Ain't Chicken Chicken: Crispy Roasted Chicken Breasts with Orange and Cardamom for similar recipes.
information.instructions: Season the flour with salt and pepper.                          With a meat mallet, pound the chicken breasts to 1/4-inch thickness. Season each breast with salt and pepper and lay 1 sage leaf on each breast. Lay 1 slice prosciutto over each piece and fold in half like a book. Secure the two sides with a toothpick and dredge each breast in the seasoned flour.                          In a heavy-bottomed pot with high sides, heat the 2 cups olive oil to 375 degrees. Make sure that you have a slotted spoon or spider close by. Working in a few batches, fry the leaves in the oil, removing with the slotted spoon after 30 seconds. Season with salt, set on a plate lined with paper towels to drain, and set aside.                          In a 12 to 14-inch saute pan, heat the remaining olive oil until smoking. Add the chicken and saute until golden brown on both sides. Add the shallots and mushrooms and cook until the mushrooms have sweated, about 5 to 6 minutes. Add the Marsala and chicken stock and cook over high heat until reduce by half. Swirl the butter into the pan, add the parsley and serve on 4 warmed dinner plates, topped with the fried sage leaves.

steps.step: Season the flour with salt and pepper.
With a meat mallet, pound the chicken breasts to 1/4-inch thickness. Season each breast with salt and pepper and lay 1 sage leaf on each breast.
Lay 1 slice prosciutto over each piece and fold in half like a book. Secure the two sides with a toothpick and dredge each breast in the seasoned flour.

In a heavy-bottomed pot with high sides, heat the 2 cups olive oil to 375 degrees. Make sure that you have a slotted spoon or spider close by. Working in a few batches, fry the leaves in the oil, removing with the slotted spoon after 30 seconds. Season with salt, set on a plate lined with paper towels to drain, and set aside.
In a 12 to 14-inch saute pan, heat the remaining olive oil until smoking.
Add the chicken and saute until golden brown on both sides.
Add the shallots and mushrooms and cook until the mushrooms have sweated, about 5 to 6 minutes.
Add the Marsala and chicken stock and cook over high heat until reduce by half. Swirl the butter into the pan, add the parsley and serve on 4 warmed dinner plates, topped with the fried sage leaves.
